author: ETA PRIME
description:
A fanless Lenovo ThinkCentre IoT / ThinkEdge mini PC with an AMD Ryzen 5 7430U (6-core / 12-thread, Zen 3) and RDNA2 iGPU (7 CUs)? These are designed for kiosk / POS / edge computing, but I had to test it like a real mini PC: 4K60 playback, temps, power draw, and even gaming (Forza Horizon 5 + Cyberpunk 2077 with FSR / Frame Gen).
This unit is completely silent (no internal fan) and uses the aluminum chassis as the cooler, but it also has a big limitation: a sustained ~25W total power budget shared between CPU and GPU. Let’s see what that means for real-world use.

title: This Mini PC Has NO FAN… But It’s Ryzen (Silent 7430U RDNA2 Test)
